Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2011 12:47PM Jamie30 wrote: They will be doing blood work the morning of my infusion.  It makes since...if I am feeling out of it by day 10 I will call.  I am prone to getting mouth issues so I knew I would get the sores.  Two days after surgery I had a weird infection of ulcers in the back of my throat.  I always get the mouth crap.  Thanks
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2011 03:55PM Jamie30 wrote: chickadee- yes my hair is short now.  I have been inching up with my hair to prepare for everything.  My hair was to the bottom of my back.  I couldnt stand to have that falling out all over the place.  I know today is only day 8 but I have noticed that I am finding a few strands here and there around my collar.  Actually just found a few on my arm and on computer.  I may just be going crazy and being paranoid or maybe I have just never noticed it before...idk.  It will all be okay..I just really do not want to have to vaccuum hair up off of everything, lol.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2011 06:00PM Jamie30 wrote: I did number 2 today.  Good luck to everyone going in this week!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2011 08:30AM Jamie30 wrote: Thanks Kathy and Merilee!  IT is always great to hear that we just might make it through chemo, lol.  At times, I wonder about that.  Melmes, I wish I could help but all I can say is I hope it eases up for you soon. Today is my day 10.  All is well for me now.  Yesterday was a little weird.  I just all of a sudden became exhausted but I took a nap and felt much better.  Maybe I just needed to rest.  My hair is shedding but not falling out just yet.  Plan on getting that taken care of today or tomorrow.  My hubby and boys are going with me to my sisters salon and buzzing my head.  I go to see my PS today to get my second fill on my TEs.  I am hoping he can give me some advice about the acne that I have managed to get on my chest and face.  I might just visit his wife.  She is an estetician in his office.  Hope everyone has a great day today with no SEs!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 11:08AM Jamie30 wrote: I am day 14 and I have the same sinus issues.  My onc told me that it was very common and to use a qtip and swipe a little vaseline to releive some of the issue and do not blow to hard.  So does anyone know about how long it takes body hair to actually be GONE after it starts falling out.  I buzzed my head Saturday to help with shedding but today I noticed a whole new type of shedding.  I am normally a landscaped kind of girl "down there" but have slacked off ALOT since the start of chemo because the onc told me to not shave and wax due to infection and skin issues, anywho, well...today it is all falling out...like CRAZY!  I just wonder how long it takes?
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2011 08:53AM Jamie30 wrote: Hi All!  I started my Taxotere/Cytoxan on June 28th.  Today is day 8 for me and THANK GOD all is getting back to normal.  The first day and day two were good.  Day 3 I was nauseas (took med), ditzy, and tired.  Day 3 was about the same.  Day 4 was great.  Day 5 I got hit with horrible stomach issues.  I actually took a nap and woke up throwing up.  After a bit and some soup, I was okay.  Day 6 was a few pains here and there.  Day 7 was really really dry mouth and one mouth sore popped up.  Day 8 (today) my mouth isnt as dry.  Soreis still there but not bothering me.  I too have broken out like a teenager.  I have NEVER had acne but now it is all over my chest and quite a bit on my face.  I am thinking of shaving my head very soon.  I think the anxiety over "when" is it going to happen is worse for me than the actually happening.  I would prefer to just shave it instead of having clumps missing.  IDK yet.  On average...how many days before hair starts falling out?  BTW, I am not getting any shots for wbc.  I see that so many people are. That worries me a bit.  How would I know if they drop too much?
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2011 02:58PM Jamie30 wrote: CrimsonQ66 - I have the pins and needles type tingling too.  I am at Day 10 and have noticed stray hairs.  I was told around day 13-18 to expect it.  Everyone things I am being paranoid since I am looking for it to fall out but really, I had to pick 5 hairs up off my keyboard and I can say that has NEVER happened before.  I plan on going to my sisters salon tomorrow with my hubby and my boys and buzzing it.  Hope everything works out for you with the pool party!  Believe it or not I am so glad that someone mentioned alcohol.  I havent had anything to drink since my diagnosis but my friend is getting married and having a bachlorette party at the end of August and I plan on having a drink.  My onc didnt mention it either.  I wonder if any others have??? Its great that you didnt get the acne also.  I had zits the next morning after my chemo.  I was always lucky and never had to worry about acne and here I am 30 years old and dealing with it, lol.  I feel like a teenager and now I understand the pain, lol.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2011 05:51PM Jamie30 wrote: Chickadee... you know that makes perfect sense.  I have always had abnormal high white cells, found that out in middle school.  So maybe that is why I am not getting the shots as well.  Im going to plan on being boring and be happy with it unless something starts feeling wrong.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2011 08:32PM Jamie30 wrote: Hi!  I have been mia from this thread for a while.  I am doing okay.  I am day 8 of my second T/C.  Day 2-5 I was pretty sure I was being called home to glory.  I was really sick.  I was in the hospital on day 3 for fluids and zofran.  This one has just kicked my butt.  I am pretty sure I told my hubby a few times that I was NOT going back.................but I will, lol. My uncle passed away last night.  He went into cardiac arrest on Saturday and was on life support.  Last night we took the life support off and he passed very peacefully within a few minutes.  He will be having a firemans funeral on Saturday.  He served on the department for 47 years.  I had my LAST fill today!!  YAY!!!  I am now at 800ccs and my boobs are rockin in my clothes, lol.  I will have my exchance one month after the end of chemo.  I am really excited to have the fills over with!  One more thing checked off!!  I do LOVE my PS.  He did my fills every 3 weeks because he likes to let the muscle relax and sit before stretching it again and I think that was a big help.  He also dd 400 at surgery so I only had to have 3 fills.  The firs 150, then 100, and today 150.  I am really happy that this is now checked off until my exchange!!!  Chickadee- hope everything works out with your TE!  BTW, that little patch behind the ear is a miracle.  I have always been VERY sick after surger so this time they did the patch and 2 nausea meds before surgery and another after....I wasnt sick AT ALL!!! Catron- I have the runny nose also!  Hope everyone is having a good day and NO SEs!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2011 06:03PM Jamie30 wrote: I also do not get the shot.  My first treatment everything was ok.  It wasnt a walk in the park but Im still here.  My second treatment, I had alot of SEs but I was also getting an upper resp infection, so I think that is what kicked everything up.  I am day 13 from second treatment and I am back to normal with the exception of a stupid sore on the corner of my mouth that refuses to go away and a red patch on my hand...idk what that is.  Red patch... I noticed last week that I had a red area where the iv was for my FIRST treatment, it didnt pop up until right after my second treatment. It didnt hurt but was really red.  Now it looks like an old bruise and the skin has peeled arund it.   Now I have a RED patch about the size of a quarter where my iv was for my second treatment.  This one feels a little warm and is a little sore if I poke it.  Has anyone experienced this.  It doesnt bother me other than being a little bothersome to be polka dotted.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 07:30PM Jamie30 wrote: Hi.  I am stage II also.  I was diagnosed on April 11 2011 with multifocal invasice ductal carcinoma.  I had my bmx on may 26th and I decided to go with TE.  I have had one fill right now and will find out on Thursday next week if the onc wants to go ahead with chemo.  They are on the fence because what was in my node was small.  They are leaning towards chemo but want to wait for my oncotype test to come back in.  I just wanted to stop in and say hi.
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 03:36PM Jamie30 wrote: My ONC was the one who decided I needed the Oncotype.  I was diagnosed with multifocal invasive ductal carcinoma on APril 11th 2011.  I had my BMX on May 26th.  They thought my lymphnodes were clear until they were sent off to path.  I had one node come back with a .28 mm so all of my drs are on the fence about chemo.  We are doing the test to know if I should do chemo.  I will be doing the Tamoxifen for 5 years reguardless because of my ER/PR+.
